title: Rudolf II's Prague Court: Alchemy & Astronomy
description: The brilliant circle of alchemists, astronomers, and occult philosophers at Emperor Rudolf II's Prague court (1583-1612): John Dee's Enochian revelations, Michael Maier's alchemical emblems, Kepler's cosmic harmonies, Tycho's observations, and Sendivogius's 'New Light of Alchemy'.
keyFigures: John Dee (1527-1608): English polymath, Enochian spirit communications with Edward Kelley
Michael Maier (1568-1622): Physician to Rudolf II, alchemical philosopher
Tycho Brahe (1546-1601): Imperial astronomer, observational astronomy
Johannes Kepler (1571-1630): Imperial Mathematician, planetary laws, cosmic harmonies
Michael Sendivogius (1566-1636): Polish alchemist, influenced Newton
researchValue: Documents the remarkable convergence of alchemy, astronomy, and occult philosophy at Rudolf II's Prague court - a pivotal moment in the history of science and esotericism.
